title: Provides improved access to taxicabs for persons with disabilities
summary: Provides improved access to taxi cabs for persons with disabilities.

S T A T E   O F   N E W   Y O R K
       ________________________________________________________________________

                                         1231

                              2011-2012 Regular Sessions

                                   I N  S E N A T E

                                    January 6, 2011
                                      ___________

       Introduced  by  Sen.  DUANE  -- read twice and ordered printed, and when
         printed to be committed to the Committee on Local Government

       AN ACT to amend the general municipal law, in relation to providing  for
         improved access to taxicabs for persons with disabilities

         THE  PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section 1.  Section 181 of the general municipal law,  as  amended  by
    2  chapter 579 of the laws of 1993, subdivision 1 as amended by chapter 430
    3  of the laws of 2003, is amended to read as follows:
    4    S 181. Ordinances to regulate taxicabs and limousines.  1. The munici-
    5  pal  officers  and  boards  in the several cities, towns and villages of
    6  this state now having the authority to enact ordinances, may adopt ordi-
    7  nances regulating:
    8    [1.] (A) The registration and licensing of taxicabs and may limit  the
    9  number  of  taxicabs  to  be  licensed and the county of Westchester may
   10  adopt ordinances regulating the registration and licensing  of  taxicabs
   11  and  limousines  and may limit the number to be licensed; and the county
   12  of Nassau may adopt ordinances regulating the registration  of  taxicabs
   13  and limousines.
   14    [2.]  (B)  Parking  and  passenger  pick-up and discharge by taxicabs,
   15  limousines and livery vehicles. Establishment  of  such  ordinances  and
   16  regulations  regulating parking and passenger pick-up and discharges may
   17  be based upon recommendations from municipal planning officials or other
   18  public entities  and  may  address  and  take  into  consideration  such
   19  factors,  including, but not limited to, geographic areas, vehicle type,
   20  limiting the number of parked vehicles and activities  undertaken  while
   21  parked, and periods of idling.
   22    2.  THE  MUNICIPAL OFFICERS AND BOARDS IN ANY CITY HAVING A POPULATION
   23  OF MORE THAN ONE MILLION SHALL NO LATER THAN DECEMBER THIRTY-FIRST,  TWO
   24  THOUSAND FOURTEEN ADOPT ORDINANCES PROVIDING:
   25    (A) THAT "ACCESSIBLE TAXICAB" SHALL MEAN ANY VEHICLE THAT

        EXPLANATION--Matter in ITALICS (underscored) is new; matter in brackets
                             [ ] is old law to be omitted.
                                                                  LBD01099-01-1

       S. 1231                             2

    1    (1) IS EQUIPPED WITH A LIFT, RAMP, OR ANY OTHER DEVICE, ARRANGEMENT OR
    2  ALTERATION, SO IT IS CAPABLE OF TRANSPORTING PERSONS WITH PHYSICAL DISA-
    3  BILITIES,  INCLUDING  THOSE  WHO  USE  WHEELCHAIRS, SCOOTERS AND SIMILAR
    4  DEVICES WHILE THEY REMAIN SEATED IN THEIR WHEELCHAIRS, SCOOTERS OR SIMI-
    5  LAR DEVICES;
    6    (2)  COMPLIES WITH THE SPECIFICATIONS SET FORTH IN REGULATIONS PROMUL-
    7  GATED UNDER THE AMERICANS WITH  DISABILITIES  ACT  AND  CODIFIED  AT  49
    8  C.F.R. SECTIONS 38.23, 38.25 AND 38.31, AS AMENDED, WHETHER OR NOT THOSE
    9  REGULATIONS WOULD APPLY UNDER FEDERAL LAW;
   10    (3)  IS  EQUIPPED  WITH AN ASSISTIVE LISTENING SYSTEM FOR PERSONS WITH
   11  HEARING IMPAIRMENT THAT IS CONNECTED WITH ANY INTERCOM, VIDEO  OR  AUDIO
   12  SYSTEM, WHEN SUCH A SYSTEM IS INSTALLED;
   13    (4) ASSURES THAT THE TECHNOLOGY UTILIZED BY TAXICABS IS COMPLIANT WITH
   14  THE   STANDARDS  PROMULGATED  BY  THE  COMMISSIONER  OF  TRANSPORTATION;
   15  PROVIDED THAT A LOCAL AUTHORITY WITH OVERSIGHT OVER TAXICABS, LIMOUSINES
   16  AND LIVERY VEHICLES MAY CONDUCT PILOT PROGRAMS TESTING NEW SYSTEMS;
   17    (5) IS EQUIPPED WITH STANDARDIZED SIGNS PRINTED IN: (A)  BRAILLE;  AND
   18  (B)  LARGE-PRINT TEXT SO THAT SUCH SIGNS ARE VISIBLE TO PERSONS WITH LOW
   19  VISION;
   20    (6) PROVIDES SUFFICIENT FLOOR SPACE TO ACCOMMODATE A  SERVICE  ANIMAL;
   21  AND
   22    (7)  IF  POWERED BY A HYBRID-ELECTRIC POWER PLANT, IS EQUIPPED WITH AN
   23  APPROPRIATE DEVICE TO ENABLE PERSONS WHO ARE BLIND TO HEAR THE  APPROACH
   24  OF  THE VEHICLE AS READILY AS THEY CAN HEAR A CONVENTIONAL GASOLINE-POW-
   25  ERED TAXICAB.
   26    (B) THAT NO OWNER OF A TAXICAB SHALL PLACE ANY  TAXICAB  INTO  SERVICE
   27  SUBSEQUENT  TO JUNE THIRTIETH, TWO THOUSAND FIFTEEN WHICH TAXICAB IS NOT
   28  AN ACCESSIBLE TAXICAB.
   29    3. FOR PURPOSES OF THIS SECTION, THE TERM "ASSISTIVE LISTENING SYSTEM"
   30  SHALL  MEAN  SITUATIONAL-PERSONAL   ACOUSTIC   COMMUNICATION   EQUIPMENT
   31  DESIGNED  TO  IMPROVE  THE TRANSMISSION AND AUDITORY RECEPTION OF SOUND.
   32  SUCH SYSTEM SHALL INCLUDE BUT NOT BE LIMITED  TO  THE  USE  OF  STANDARD
   33  AMPLITUDE  MODULATION  (AM),  FREQUENCY MODULATION (FM), AUDIO INDUCTION
   34  LOOP, INFRARED LIGHT SOUND, OR HARD WIRE SYSTEMS.
   35    S 2. The commissioner of transportation shall  promulgate  any  rules,
   36  regulations  and standards necessary to give effect of the provisions of
   37  this act, including, but not limited to rules, regulations and standards
   38  concerning the standardization of assistive listening technology  avail-
   39  able in taxicabs and the content of signs available in taxicabs to visu-
   40  ally impaired persons.
   41    S 3. This act shall take effect immediately.
actClause: AN ACT to amend the general municipal law, in relation to providing for improved access to taxicabs for persons with disabilities
